item.title: Raspberry Pi Setup
item.description: My Raspberry Pi setup is constantly changing. They are my mini homelab. Used when I want containers to run on a more permanant basis. All average at about 3W in power, making them very efficient to their tasks. Most have Docker installed and are blocked from access to the internet if hosting private information.

item.title: About
item.description: I am a graduate student looking for a gradauate role in Systems Administration ( or similar) within the UK. With a wide range of skills and the motivation to learn any new technology. I will be a very flexible fit for any organisation, as I spend most of my time learning and exploring all areas of technology I can find. Latest Projects This Website (Hugo) Kubernetes DIY Smart Home Tech Future Projects Exploring AWS, Azure and Google Cloud in more depth 3D Printing & Scanning Youtube Hobbies Messing around with tech Following the latest environmental news (mainly Tesla) Researching the stock market Sci-Fi, Action Dramas (the more confusing the better) Legion Mr Robot Agents of Shield Education Plymouth University - Computer Systems and Networks Skills Learned/improved upon Cisco routing and switching Cyber Security AWS (EC2) ESXI Creating mock organiastion networks Python C# MySQL

item.title: Proxmox Setup
item.description: Proxmox is hosted on my Dell R710 server. With 24 threads, 32GB of RAM and 2 TB of storage. Whilst the R710 is a powerfull system, it is very power hungry. With a minimum power draw of 180w. As a result I have made the decision to only run the server when I wish to mess around with virtual machines. It’s main purpose is for developing more solid applications that can be deployed to more power efficient systems.
